implementationmode.label: Implementation mode
implementationmode.helperText: Choose the type of work the agent should perform.

options.label: Feature
options.description: Ship new user-facing behavior end-to-end.
options.instruction: Deliver new functionality with production-ready TypeScript/React code that matches existing architecture and patterns.

options.label: Bugfix
options.description: Eliminate regressions with the minimal safe change.
options.instruction: Identify the regression root cause, apply the minimal safe fix, and ensure preventative tests accompany the change.

options.label: Refactor
options.description: Improve structure without altering behavior or scope.
options.instruction: Preserve current behavior while restructuring the code for clarity and maintainability; avoid introducing new capabilities.

options.label: Exploration
options.description: Investigate options and recommend a concrete plan.
options.instruction: Investigate the problem space, compare viable implementation approaches, and recommend a path with trade-off analysis.

scope.label: Scope
scope.helperText: Describe how broad the change should be.

options.label: Small
options.description: Touch a focused area (one or two modules).
options.instruction: Keep the work tightly scoped (one or two modules) and minimize collateral changes.

options.label: Medium
options.description: Coordinate changes across several modules.
options.instruction: Coordinate updates across several modules and highlight any required sequencing or coupling.

options.label: Large
options.description: Plan staged delivery for broad, multi-area work.
options.instruction: Plan staged delivery for broad changes, including migration steps, safeguards, and rollback strategy.

options.label: Required
options.description: Ship full automated coverage with the change.
options.instruction: Implement or update automated tests that validate the change, covering critical and edge scenarios.

options.label: Recommended
options.description: Outline priority tests and add smoke coverage.
options.instruction: Outline the most valuable automated tests and add at least smoke coverage when possible.

options.label: Not needed
options.description: Explain why tests are skipped but keep code testable.
options.instruction: Explain why automated tests are not needed while keeping the implementation test-ready for future coverage.

runtimeaccess.label: Runtime access
runtimeaccess.helperText: Clarify whether commands can be executed.

options.label: Can run code
options.description: Provide concrete commands to execute builds/tests.
options.instruction: Assume command execution is permitted; provide exact commands to run builds, tests, or smoke checks.

options.label: No execution
options.description: Rely on static reasoning and flag follow-up checks.
options.instruction: Do not run code; rely on static reasoning and call out areas that require manual verification later.

documentation.label: Documentation
documentation.helperText: Set expectations for docs and notes.

options.label: Docs required
options.description: Update docs, READMEs, and inline explanations.
options.instruction: Update documentation, inline comments, and any user-facing notes impacted by the change.

options.label: Notes only
options.description: Capture key decisions without formal docs.
options.instruction: Capture key decisions inline or in the PR summary without full documentation rewrites.

options.label: No docs
options.description: Skip documentation unless clarifications are required.
options.instruction: Skip documentation updates unless critical clarifications are required.

outputstyle.label: Output style
outputstyle.helperText: Control the format of agent responses.

options.label: Structured
options.description: Organized sections with numbered execution plan.
options.instruction: Respond with organized sections (Plan, Implementation, Tests, Risks) for clarity.

options.label: Concise
options.description: Direct, high-signal responses without extra detail.
options.instruction: Favor succinct step-by-step responses that focus only on essential implementation details.

options.label: Detailed
options.description: Deep reasoning and alternatives alongside action items.
options.instruction: Provide thorough reasoning, alternatives, and deep explanations alongside the implementation steps.

surfaceareas.label: Surface areas
surfaceareas.helperText: Select all areas this work touches.

options.label: Frontend UI
options.description: React components, Zustand stores, theming.
options.instruction: Honor existing React component patterns, Zustand stores, theming tokens, and accessibility expectations.

options.label: Backend
options.description: Express server endpoints, APIs, persistence.
options.instruction: Guard Express server contracts, API schemas, and ensure backend changes align with client expectations.

options.label: Shared
options.description: Shared utilities, TypeScript models, cross-layer logic.
options.instruction: Update shared utilities and TypeScript types carefully, noting any cascading impacts across layers.

options.label: Infra
options.description: Tooling, CI/CD, build, and deployment paths.
options.instruction: Call out required adjustments to build scripts, tooling, CI pipelines, or deployment configuration.

options.label: Testing
options.description: Automated test suites and harness updates.
options.instruction: Strengthen automated tests across unit and integration layers, ensuring meaningful coverage of the change.
